channel.title: Hl1 health charger
channel.description:
Ok so in hl1 and in hl2 there are health charger and you go up and charge yourself back to health, my question is, how could we accomplish in making a device like this in real life? and how does it exactly work, does it insert a tube into you and heal you in like a minute? I mean if all people had to do if they were hurt was to push a button to be healed that would be a breakthrough in medical science.
![](upload://hv6NR2jkeEFm4N0vSDyWOjYk1vh.jpeg)

item.title: Hl1 health charger
item.dc:creator: Piefish
item.description:
I have the PS2 version, if you activate the cheat to play as a vortigaunt health stations actually harm you D:

I feel uncomfortable with that needle following me around aswell…plotting…waiting…

Read full topic

item.title: Hl1 health charger
item.dc:creator: Piefish
item.description:
Neroz:

Ok so in hl1 and in hl2 there are health charger and you go up and charge yourself back to health, my question is, how could we accomplish in making a device like this in real life? and how does it exactly work, does it insert a tube into you and heal you in like a minute? I mean if all people had to do if they were hurt was to push a button to be healed that would be a breakthrough in medical science.

You don’t

because it’s a game :hmph:

Read full topic

item.title: Hl1 health charger
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Neroz:

how do you know thats water? it could be Vortigaunt jizz or Houndeye piss.

Well, it isn’t “water” because water doesn’t heal wounds or glow. I guess you could say it came from some underground source, which would explain why it never runs out. With that mindset you’d also have to assume the HEV suit for some reason has the ability to suck that water up through it’s boots.

I just wish there was a bit more consistency with color & status effects (hl2: medkits are green, health chargers blue, batteries blue, suit chargers orange) or at least some in-game explanation for why things glow these colors.

Read full topic

item.title: Hl1 health charger
item.dc:creator: Neroz
item.description:
Coca-Cola curing cancer, and disease since 1886

Read full topic

item.title: Hl1 health charger
item.dc:creator: NomadHH
item.description:
MarshmallowRadiation:

Probably injects you with the “green stuff” from hl2. Or green-stuff-coated nanobots go through your skin (through your finger?)

it does inject you with some sorta green stuff. cause if you look at half life ecay expansion the health chargers have more detail and you can see the green stuff in a container. i agree with the other guys by saying that the color green probably comes from the combination of soda and insulin lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Hl1 health charger
item.dc:creator: doomyshadowsquirrels
item.description:
The Combine Aide Chargers most likely contain a shitload of enzymes that promote rapid healing, or some other sci-fi jargon that sounds dumb to say aloud. I think Gordon can only use them because of his HEV Suit, tho, and only he and Combine Soldiers can use them because the Citizens don’t have a bodysuit that will properly administer the ‘green stuff’.

The Black Mesa Health Stations look to be an emergency case full of First-Aid supplies with a numeric key-pad, the effect in-game is just to simplify the concept.

Read full topic

item.title: Hl1 health charger
item.dc:creator: Sgt_smiles
item.description:
Medkit:

I bet the armor chargers are giving juice to your HEV suit, while the health chargers are giving some kind of pain killer or medicine, (maybe morphium, not sure). Anyway there is a wire (or [COLOR=‘Red’]braid) to connect the charger to your suit. Sounds logic.

321×501 172 KB

wait a minute! aren’t you the future man? you should know all of this!

item.title: Hl1 health charger
item.dc:creator: Medkit
item.description:
I bet the armor chargers are giving juice to your HEV suit, while the health chargers are giving some kind of pain killer or medicine, (maybe morphium, not sure). Anyway there is a wire (or braid) to connect the charger to your suit. Sounds logic.

But Health- or Armor Charger in real life? Well, first of all you need a secret underground facility with a 50 billion dollar budget to have things like these.

But hey, we alredy have soda machines!

Read full topic
